Prerequisites: JUNIOR STANDING, ACCOUNTING MAJOR AND MAC 1105, ECO 2013, ECO 2023, ACG 2071, EACH WITH A GRADE OF C (2.0) OR BETTER.
Course Description: A STUDY OF COST-VOLUME-PRICE RELATIONSHIPS, JOB ORDER COSTING, PROCESS COSTING, STANDARD COSTING, JOINT AND BYPRODUCT COSTING, DIRECT AND INDIRECT COSTING, VARIABLE COSTING, AND ABSORPTION COSTING
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE END OF THE COURSE, STUDENTS WHO COMPLETED ALL ASSIGNMENTS AND PARTICIPATED IN CLASS AND GROUP DISCUSSIONS SHOULD BE ABLE TO:
UNDERSTAND COST-VOLUME-PROFIT RELATIONSHIPS
UNDERSTAND JOB ORDER COSTING.
UNDERSTAND PROCESS AND STANDARD COSTING
UNDERSTAND JOINT AND BYPRODUCT COSTING. 
UNDERSTAND DIRECT AND INDIRECT COSTING. 
UNDERSTAND VARIABLE AND ABSORPTION COSTING.
POSSESS THE ABILITY TO PROFICIENTLY USE THE ACCOUNTING KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS ACQUIRED IN THE COURSE.
PREPARE, REVIEW, AND ANALYZE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN MS EXCEL.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
